Play: the Page of P's

While projects like research papers and coming up with the code/design for this website are fun, I do have a handful of non-academic, non-coding hobbies, including piano, lifting, cuddling with my cat, and delving into political philosophy.

Warning: this page displays content containing piano, art, sports, and cats, among other miscellaneous items. Proceed with caution.

NOTE: all the text in light blue are active links. Click on any light blue text to be taken to an external link!

Photography

In 2014, with the money that I saved up from my very first job, I purchased a DSLR camera-- the Nikon D5200 with an 18mm-55mm zoom lens-- which I still use to this day. Below are some sample shots of my photography style, but you can view the entire portfolio for my photography work at @aladeraphoto .

Piano

Of all the activities on this page, piano is probably the one I've been doing the longest (I started when I was 9! Unfortunately, I also took a very long pause that lasted for the entire duration of undergrad, which adds up to 9 solid years of actually playing the piano). I'm still hunting for the best films of my full performances, but for now, here are some clips of me fooling around on those black and white keys (aka, practicing or meme-ing).

Physical

As much as I love sitting idly at my computer to do research, I also appreciate getting active every once in a while. From left to right are snapshots of me in action: hitting a 2 plate conventional deadlift in Halloween costume (Nov. 2023), my most recent v5 (May. 2023), performing the V-split elbow lever (Nov. 2022), and my first (and only) half marathon (Nov. 2016).

Production

As part of my curriculum for My International Baccalaureate Higher Level Music (IB Music HL) class, I composed two pieces, which helped me to score a 5 on my overall IB Music HL portfolio.

• The Escape - for symphony orchestra
• Winter Prelude - for solo piano

Some of my athlete stats. Many of these started recently, so I'm very excited to see some progress!

Lifting (max set x 5) @ 110lbs / 50kg BW (c. August 2023)
• deadlift (conventional): 235lbs / 106.6kg / 2.14x BW
• squat: 190lbs / 86.2kg / 1.73x BW
• bench: 90lbs / 40.8kg / 0.81x BW
Rock climbing (c. September 2022)
• v5's completed: x2 • v4 (currently)
Calisthenics (c. November 2022)
• V-split elbow lever • x10 pistol squat • 10 pull ups • L-sit • skin the cat!
Running (c. 2015, retired)
• 6:28 mile PR; 24:37 5K / 3mi PR • 1 x 13.1 mi (half marathon)

Plates

What better way to test your creativity than by experimenting with flavor combinations? Featured are some of my favorite dishes turned vegetarian, including tacos, ramen, lumpia (a Filipino favorite), and banana pancakes with homemade whipped cream.

Portobello

I have an adorable round void named Portobello. Contrary to the reputation of black cats being reclusive Halloweenie mascots, this little guy is extremely cuddly, and loves to snuggle in his sleep!

Plantastic

In my free time, one of my other hobbies is botany. Some of my recent plants are featured below, including an unlucky visitor to my venus fly traps and a fresh pick from my bell pepper plant.
